fr.sii.ogham.sms.message

Class Sms

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.sii.ogham.sms.message.Sms
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Message

    public class Sms
extends Object
implements Message
    SMS message that contains the following information:
    • The content of the SMS (see Content and sub classes for more information)
    • The sender information (name and phone number). Name is optional
    • The list of recipients (name and phone number). Name is optional
    Author:
    Aur√©lien Baudet

    • Constructor Detail

      • Sms

        public Sms()
        Default constructor for using fluent API. This constructor initializes nothing.

      • Sms

        public Sms(String content,
           String to,
           String... tos)
        Initialize the SMS with the following information:
        • The content of the SMS as string, it will create a StringContent for you
        • One or several recipients using only phone numbers

        No sender is specified. This information can be automatically added according to the behaviors you have selected see SmsBuilder for more information). Alternatively, you can manually add it using setFrom(Sender) or setFrom(String) methods.

        Parameters:
        content - the content of the SMS
        to - one mandatory recipient for the SMS
        tos - the other optional recipients of the SMS

      • Sms

        public Sms(String content,
           PhoneNumber to,
           PhoneNumber... tos)
        Initialize the SMS with the following information:
        • The content of the SMS as string, it will create a StringContent for you
        • The sender information (name and phone number). Name is optional
        • One or several recipients using only phone numbers
        Parameters:
        content - the content of the SMS
        to - one mandatory recipient for the SMS
        tos - the other optional recipients of the SMS

        public Sms(String content,
           Recipient... to)
        Initialize the SMS with the following information:
        • The content of the SMS as string, it will create a StringContent for you
        • None, one or several recipients (name and phone number). Name is optional

        No sender is specified. This information can be automatically added according to the behaviors you have selected see SmsBuilder for more information). Alternatively, you can manually add it using setFrom(Sender) or setFrom(String) methods.

        Parameters:
        content - the content of the SMS
        to - the recipients of the SMS
